name: UICollectionViewDropDelegate
desc: The interface for handling drops in a collection view.

items.name: func collectionView(UICollectionView, canHandle: UIDropSession) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks your delegate whether the collection view can accept a drop with the specified type of data.

items.name: func collectionView(UICollectionView, performDropWith: UICollectionViewDropCoordinator)
items.desc: Tells your delegate to incorporate the drop data into the collection view.

items.name: func collectionView(UICollectionView, dropSessionDidUpdate: UIDropSession, withDestinationIndexPath: IndexPath?) -> UICollectionViewDropProposal
items.desc: Tells your delegate that the position of the dragged data over the collection view changed.

items.name: func collectionView(UICollectionView, dropSessionDidEnter: UIDropSession)
items.desc: Notifies you when dragged content enters the collection view’s bounds rectangle.

items.name: func collectionView(UICollectionView, dropSessionDidExit: UIDropSession)
items.desc: Notifies you when dragged content exits the table view’s bounds rectangle.

items.name: func collectionView(UICollectionView, dropSessionDidEnd: UIDropSession)
items.desc: Notifies you when the drag operation ends.

items.name: func collectionView(UICollectionView, dropPreviewParametersForItemAt: IndexPath) -> UIDragPreviewParameters?
items.desc: Returns custom information about how to display the item at the specified location during the drop.
